result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan S. Bulka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[JK] cases #15CF43 and #16CM487 called at 2:13pm
Defendant Dylan S. Bulka in court, in custody, with Attorney Samantha Humes.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Humes indicates they are prepared to proceed to Plea and Sentencing in 16CM487
Plea Hearing held in case 16CM487 only.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments on both cases were given by Counsel.
The Court addresses Mr. Bulka.

In case #15CF43, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges including for employment, counseling, and including AODA treatment; to commence forthwith 
--87 days credit for time already served given 
--Mr. Bulka is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--pay costs, fees, and assessments
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment against the defendant and in favor of the County for any outstanding financial obligations.

In case 16CM487, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges including for employment, counseling, and including AODA treatment; this sentence is consecutive to #15CF43 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Bulka is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment against the defendant and in favor of the County for any outstanding financial obligations.

recess: 2:42pm

Warrant cancellation notice with fax confirmation
Duplicate original warrant returned
Defendant made voluntary appearance

Case called at 10:31 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dylan S. Bulka in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews criminal case settlement with Mr. Bulka
off-record: 10:35 - 10:37 am for ADA Fryatt to address another matter

On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS charge to misdemeanor battery, domestic abuse, contrary to 940.19(1) & 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor
Atty Dahnert addresses domestic abuse enhancer, indicates that Mr. Bulka was actually a guest so the domestic abuse enhancer would not apply
Court/Counsel discuss; Mr. Bulka informs the Court that he would like to proceed today

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--Continue with mental health treatment until discharged by his treating professionals
--Take all prescription medications as prescribed
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence to any person
--Undergo Anger Management counseling
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--Repayment of Attorney fees

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court finds that society would not be harmed & the Defendant would benefit and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation, under 973.015
Court quashes warrant
Recess: 10:51 am
Clerk to update address//Warrant remains outstanding
Letter from the def ref correct mailing address
Extradition Forecast

[MK] case called at 9:11am. 
Attorney Sylvie Dahnert in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Dahnert indicates that she does not have an explanation regarding Defendant Dylan Bulka's non-appearance. However Attorney Dahnert indicates that Mr. Bulka has been in very regular contact up until this past week; she lists a series of dates in April when Mr. Bulka had telephone contact with her. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant- body only. The Court finds the Signature Bond to be in default; the Court orders the Bond to be forfeited. 
The Court denies Attorney Dahnert's request for a stay of the warrant. 
recess 9:19am.
Status conference on May 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Reminder of payment extension
The Court appoints Attorney Dahnert//repayment order of $100 per month starting 04-24-15

Cases 15CF43 and 15CF45 called at 11:25am [mo]
Co-Defendant Troy T Thorsen in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  
Co-Defendant Dylan S. Bulka appears in court 
ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In response to the Court inquiry, Mr. Bulka indicates he is was told he does not qualify for PD representation.
The Court instructs the Clerk to present Mr. Bulka with a Petition for Court appointed Counsel.
Recess in case 15CF43---to allow Mr. Bulka to complete Petition

In Case 15CF45:
Mr. Thorsen  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived


Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts 4 & 5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3.
The Court finds there is victim rights compliance and no request to be heard
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
The Defense submits a letter--marked as exhibit #1
Statement made by Mr. Thorsen 

On Counts #4 & #5, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to continue with mental health treatment until discharged by professionals
--take all prescription medication as directed
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo anger management
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge 
--On Count #5: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
Recess in case 15CF45: 11:56am---Atty. Svehlek and Mr. Thorsen exit the courtroom  
Reconvene in case 15CF43
The Court reviews Mr. Bulka's Petition, making inquiries of him regarding his finances.
The Court finds that Mr. Bulka is eligible for the appointment of counsel. The Court grants the petition.
The Court orders that the appointed Counsel contact the JA to schedule a Pretrial and STC. 
The Court orders Mr. Bulka to contact the attorney appointed to his case as soon as notice is obtained.
The Court requires Mr. Bulka to make $100 per month payments toward reimbursement of attorney fees, commencing 4/24/15 and on the 24th day of each month thereafter until further ordered by the Court. 
recess in case 15CF43: 12:03am

In Case 15CF43 NEXT: Assign Mr. Bulka a Court appointed attorney---The Court has ordered that this appointed attorney is to contact the JA to schedule PTC and STC
Defendnat has requested SPD appear for bond purposes only
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 08:40 am.

Case called at 1:33pm
Defendant Dylan S. Bulka appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (for bond purpsoses only). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint  appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Right to Counsel given; contructive waiver of counsel given

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--not to commit any acts of violence and not to make any threats to any person
--not to discuss the case with Tanja Jorju OR Joann Thorsen OR Troy Thorsen
recess 1:38 pm.
